title: Timelord2067
author: Timelord2067
created_time: February 21, 2023, 03:46:11 AMLast edit: May 15, 2023, 02:13:41 AM by Timelord2067
content: Background:Part 1.Text u=807536 [BPIP] (an account seller) uses the two twitter handles alvincaguilar and onlinemoney0217 in this locked thread post: [Ninja]Quote from: Text on April 18, 2021, 04:54:56 AMI'm Subscribed.Your Bitcointalk Username: TextYour Twitter Post Link:https://twitter.com/alvincaguilar (@alvincaguilar)https://twitter.com/onlinemoney0217 (@onlinemoney0217)snipTwitter Audit Link:https://twitteraudit.com/alvincaguilarhttps://twitteraudit.com/onlinemoney0217OnlineMoney u=927672 [BPIP] also uses the Twitter handle onlinemoney0217 in this locked post three days later: [Ninja]Quote from: OnlineMoney on April 21, 2021, 09:40:47 AMTwitter Profile Link : https://twitter.com/onlinemoney0217Retweet Links : https://twitter.com/bnswap1/status/1384618490225733634Submit Date : 4/21/2021Submit BinanceSmartChain wallet address : 0x0E51cc492b0a171ab5d2Ba053C56f99141d40365Text uses the wallet address 0xf6D938d1773c65FD1769778D4B51243a801D29D5 in this post from June 2022 [Ninja]Quote from: Text on June 01, 2022, 02:08:18 AMAll right, let's try.I will post my MEW wallet address here: 0xf6D938d1773c65FD1769778D4B51243a801D29D5Can you pinpoint what and how many tokens were stolen from me?I won’t give a clue for now. Can you determine when this happened?OnlineMoney also uses the wallet address 0xf6D938d1773c65FD1769778D4B51243a801D29D5 in this post: [Ninja] NOTE THE DATE: November, 2019.  i.e. OnlineMoney uses that address first.Quote from: OnlineMoney on November 17, 2019, 11:40:29 PMProof of Authentication:Bitcointalk Username: OnlineMoneyERC20 Wallet: 0xf6D938d1773c65FD1769778D4B51243a801D29D5Conclusion: They are alts.2 Accounts Connected:Text, OnlineMoney,Proof:As above.Part 2.In the campaign ? Torcoin Social Media Campaign ? ?? Get 0.1$ per post! the Campaign Manager is @iluvbitcoinsI am providing a screen shot of posts #126 and #128 - as you can see OnlineMoney and then two posts later, Text claim from the same campaign.Conclusion:"Text" & "OnlineMoney" are Twitter campaign abusers....Part 3. This is where I need your help.Between them both, Text and OnlineMoney have posted dozens of Twitter handles in their campaign posts.  I haven't as yet been able to sit down and study them for comparison to find other alts that I have no doubt exist by connecting these two alts to other alts/scammers.Related Addresses:Well... this is where I need your help too.  There are a number of ETH/ERC20 addresses (as well as bitcoin wallet addresses) that are used by these two UID's and, I was hoping some of the Known Alts investigators might want to sink their teeth into searching out connections with other UID's (as they are far better at sniffing out ERC20 address and transactions than I am).Reporting:These alts have been reported by me in the "[Report] Ban Evasion [Requesting Admin/mod to check those and ban]" thread for ban evasion - NOT YET... I have marked these user's trust feedback pages with distrust feedback.Miscellaneous: Text is DT2 through the good grace of campaign manager @CryptopreneurBrainboss i.e. https://loyce.club/trust/2023-02-18_Sat_05.07h/807536.html and was probably ripping off @Hhampuz who is Campaign Manager for the Freebitco.in signature campaign with their attempt at participation in that campaign.QuoteTrust list for: Text (Trust: neutral) (65 Merit earned) (Trust list) (BPIP) (created 2023-02-18_Sat_05.07h)Back to indexText Trusts these users' judgement:1. yahoo62278 (Trust:  +34 / =2 / -0) (2950 Merit earned) (Trust list) (BPIP)2. Hhampuz (Trust:  +127 / =3 / -0) (4307 Merit earned) (Trust list) (BPIP)3. CryptopreneurBrainboss (Trust:  +19 / =0 / -0) (DT1! (12) 3226 Merit earned) (Trust list) (BPIP)4. cryptoaddictchie (Trust:  +2 / =0 / -0) (1249 Merit earned) (Trust list) (BPIP)5. The Cryptovator (Trust:  +22 / =1 / -0) (DT1! (21) 2043 Merit earned) (Trust list) (BPIP)Text Distrusts these users' judgement:1. ~Dennicex (Trust:  +0 / =0 / -2) (1 Merit earned) (Trust list) (BPIP)2. ~Kaonashi1993 (Trust:  +0 / =0 / -2) (3 Merit earned) (Trust list) (BPIP)3. ~TwitchStrmrs (Trust:  +0 / =0 / -1) (0 Merit earned) (Trust list) (BPIP)Text's judgement is Trusted by:1. CryptopreneurBrainboss (Trust:  +19 / =0 / -0) (DT1! (12) 3226 Merit earned) (Trust list) (BPIP)~Text's judgement is Distrusted by:-Trust list: backscratchers: users agree, they trust or distrust each other.Trust list: backstabbers: users disagree, one user trust the other, while the other distrust him.Source: LoyceV's Trust list viewer.Get your own Trust list in BBCode at loyce.club/trust.Hopefully @JollyGood and some others might be able to:Code:~Text~OnlineMoneyThanks everyone.

comments.author: Text
comments.created_time: March 24, 2023, 04:05:48 PMLast edit: March 24, 2023, 04:16:03 PM by Text
comments.body: Hi guys, it's me Text, the one that uses this account since the owner of this account was turnover to me by a stranger Facebook user way back in 2016.I just want to clarify that I, the user that owns this account now was just given to me by the creator, I am not an account seller. Maybe the one that created this account.I didn't buy this account from him, this was given to me when I asked for help from him when I got an issue registering an account on this forum, he is the one that introduces me to Bitcoin and this forum.My comment for Part 2:Hmm, as far as I know, having an alt account here on this forum is not forbidden, it is not also suggested nor recommended but I can see that some of the members have their own alt account/s. My mistake here is I didn't confirm on this forum that this user Text has an alt account OnlineMoney, which I successfully registered on my end.With regard to the Torcoin socmed campaign, there's a rule of 1 account per each social media. It didn't say whether an alt account is allowed or not. So I presume having different accounts and a different socmed account is allowed. I admit I just came here in my early days just to earn by posting... But of course, it changed as the years pass by, when I got more understanding of the work around here especially when I got tagged as a spammer, I learned a lot from it. And I already stop using my second account joining campaigns.Yeah, I might abuse some of the bounty campaigns before, maybe I just did that cause of a lack of knowledge, I am not fully aware of how to work on this forum. But yeah, I am not reasoning this just to have pity on me.It's still up to you guys how to judge me, but I am telling my story now.I might be an abuser of bounty socmed campaign participants for having an alt account with a different socmed account too,  but I didn't scam here directly and I can't do that.

comments.author: LeGaulois

comments.body: Jesus Christ! How come that?Regarding the screenshot Part 2.The twitter account https://twitter.com/Bitcoin_Friend ... is mineI can guarantee that 1) it is my twitter handle and 2) I have nothing to do with this guyedit:OK, it was a campaign I participated in (my post here)The guy litterally cheated @iluvbitcoins by posting something he doesn't own. (Not the first time someone use my twitter account to cheat a campaign manager)Quote from: Text on March 24, 2023, 04:05:48 PMYeah, I might abuse some of the bounty campaigns before, maybe I just did that cause of a lack of knowledge, I am not fully aware of how to work on this forum. But yeah, I am not reasoning this just to have pity on me.It's still up to you guys how to judge me, but I am telling my story now.You cheated the person running the campaignYou claimed to be me.I don't give a fuck to your lack of knowledge. If you have a brain, you know it's not right

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: Quote from: LeGaulois on March 28, 2023, 12:13:45 PMJesus Christ! How come that?Regarding the screenshot Part 2.The twitter account https://twitter.com/Bitcoin_Friend ... is mineI can guarantee that 1) it is my twitter handle and 2) I have nothing to do with this guyTime and again I've seen one punk copying the details of another - why I don't know (sometimes lazy, other times FUD ??) in the case of the Twitter handle onlinemoney0217 Text uses it first then three days later so does OnlineMoney.Similarly, OnlineMoney uses the wallet address 0xf6D938d1773c65FD1769778D4B51243a801D29D5 then two and a half years later so does Text.There is no suggestion the twitter handle Bitcoin_Friend as seen in the screen shot is connected by both of these alts - it's FUD or at best lazy copying.QuoteOK, it was a campaign I participated in (my post here)The guy litterally cheated @iluvbitcoins by posting something he doesn't own. (Not the first time someone use my twitter account to cheat a campaign manager)Quote from: Text on March 24, 2023, 04:05:48 PMYeah, I might abuse some of the bounty campaigns before, maybe I just did that cause of a lack of knowledge, I am not fully aware of how to work on this forum. But yeah, I am not reasoning this just to have pity on me.It's still up to you guys how to judge me, but I am telling my story now.You cheated the person running the campaignYou claimed to be me.I don't give a fuck to your lack of knowledge. If you have a brain, you know it's not rightSelf admission is usually how scammers come undone as evidenced by Text admission you have quoted.

comments.author: Text
comments.body: Okay guys, sorry for the mistakes I've done in the past. I know that just being sorry has nothing to do with this anymore.But I assure you that it has never been repeated and will not happen again. Thank you.

And an account with a red trust, so an account causing problem before.How many "errors" do you plan to make?

comments.author: nutildah
comments.body: Quote from: LeGaulois on April 03, 2023, 02:00:56 PMBut while removing my feedback, I see you were selling an account here. And an account with a red trust, so an account causing problem before.How many "errors" do you plan to make?In the spirit of forgiveness, you should still consider removing it as both 'crimes' were committed several years ago. The only reason this topic was created is because Text had left a negative trust for the OP a while back and it became visible after he was (briefly) promoted to DT2. Text has since deleted the offending red trust, yet picked up one of his own along the way.

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: Users such as this :Quote from: nutildah on April 10, 2023, 10:39:10 AM,..will always put a negative spin on others (especially if those users have ever lost out financially through the loss of sales of farmed alt accounts or multiple claims from the same signature campaign for example).The two alts identified in the OP are but two of many - my request is that others assist to look through the multitude of twitter accounts the two have used and match their use to other UID's .Had the previous poster actually read the OP they would know this. Instead they want to create FUD where there is none.

comments.author: Text
comments.body: I want to make it clear that the Text account was given to me, and I did not purchase it. At the time, I had nothing to offer the original owner in return. However, I later discovered that the account had been linked to others as the previous owner was an account seller.As a newbie account, the previous owner gave it to me, and I changed the email address and password to make it my own. On April 9, 2016, the day the account was turned over to me, I began browsing the forum and made my first post.I would like to apologize for my past behavior as a campaign abuser. It was a foolish mistake to join campaigns with red flags. At that time, I did not have enough knowledge about it, and all I knew was to post more to earn more.As a precautionary measure, I created an alt account named OnlineMoney in case something happened to the Text account. However, I made a mistake by using it to claim other tweets. I thought it would go unnoticed, but I realized it was wrong. Apart from that, I do not have any other alt accounts on this forum.I recall that the Text account was locked out because it had been reported for spamming, and Lauda red-tagged the account when I fell into the trap of a bumping service offer. However, before she left the forum, I asked her if she could remove the tag that had been hanging on my account for a year (I am not sure of the exact duration), and I promised that I had learned my lesson and would not repeat it.I have learned a lot from my mistakes and am committed to avoiding such errors in the future to maintain a good reputation.I would like to clarify that I am not using the OnlineMoney alt account and have kept it inactive.If I ever need to create a new account, I will publicly announce it in the first place.

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: Quote from: Text on April 11, 2023, 05:17:50 AMI want to make it clear that the Text account was given to me...If I ever need to create a new account, I will publicly announce it in the first place.The above is just like this nonsense from this user just now:Quote from: Qurbanshah on April 11, 2023, 10:18:24 AMQuote from: Stalker22 on April 09, 2023, 02:02:54 PM4. QurbanshahSnip7. Bahadurmunir   <-- Ban evasion11. Cat1 <-- Ban evasionHi dear sir Sir, can you please check that the accounts I mentioned earlier are all dead accounts? If an account becomes dead, then I have to create a new account to continue working. I have also done the same in the past, where I used only one account at a time. Qurbanshah, this is my current account, and all the previous accounts are dead accounts. You can also see the previous posts from those accounts to verify that I did not use multiple accounts at the same time. You are my seniors, and I will follow your instructions. I have put a lot of effort into this account, so please give it a chancePlease forgive me and pardon me. I have worked very hard, and I hope my hard work doesn't go in waste. Please remove the negative trust once, and I promise to learn from your guidance. Your guidance has helped me a lot, and I am grateful for that. Please give me only one chanceBoth your post and theirs reeks of insincerity...Not saying the two of you are alts, just it's a tactic scammers use to charm their way into scamming more.

He already deleted his negative trust against you and has expressed remorse for his years-old actions more than once now. Quote from: LeGaulois on March 28, 2023, 12:13:45 PMYou cheated the person running the campaignYou claimed to be me.Yes but he didn't even get paid his 15 cents for it. And it was literally nearly six years ago, LOL.

And it was literally nearly six years ago, LOL.Are they your alts?  Is that why you are taking the word of a scammer that they have changed their ways?  Did you sell them the account?  Why are you still Trolling with FUD?

comments.author: Text
comments.body: Quote from: Timelord2067 on April 11, 2023, 10:41:57 AM-snipThe above is just like this nonsense from this user just now:-snipBoth your post and theirs reeks of insincerity...Not saying the two of you are alts, just it's a tactic scammers use to charm their way into scamming more.I'm just trying to say that I am willing to let everyone know if the time comes when I need to create another account, which I didn't do before.Yes, I made mistakes; I cheated, spammed, abused, scammed, and what else? Name them all. But after the year 2017, when this account received a negative rating, I never repeated the same errors or committed another mistake.Are you perfect? Haven't you made any mistakes in your life?I'm trying to stay humble, but it seems like you're pushing too hard as if my sin is unforgivable.Tell me, are you doing this just because you were hurt when I left a negative rating on your account? Is this revenge? Oh yeah, like what I did to you when you accused this account of being a seller. Yeah, I accept your reason because that's when my story was untold.FYI, I am not asking for forgiveness just to use it as a tactic to scam more.I can be honest, and I'm telling the truth. How can I prove it? It's all up to you.

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: Incorrect. I was not "hurt" or anything else when you left your retaliatory negative trust feedback (I never even noticed).How many years ago was it that you left it? (And, I said nothing in all that time - why should I?)
